solana: Fix logic error in Inbox release process

There are a few suspicious aspects of the inbox release logic:
1. `release_inbound_unlock` takes a flag that determines whether a
   `false` result from `try_release` should cause an error. The flag
   indicates that it should revert on delay. However, `try_release` can
   also return `false` when a transaction has not been approved. If the
   flag is set, the transaction will not return an error when a user
   tries to release a transaction that is not approved even though
   whether a transaction is approved has nothing to do with its expected
   behaviour when it is delayed
2. The custom error TransferNotApproved is defined but unused

Taken together, I believe `try_release()` should revert with the
TransferNotApproved error. This would disambiguate the various 'false'
results and provide more intuitive behaviour when a user tries to
release a transaction that is not approved.
solana: Let redeem code return error instead of try_release
Update TS SDK to use renamed args
Update comment to match function logic

prs.title: [CLD-21]: feat(operations): introduce idempotency behaviour
prs.truncated_body:
When a sequence or an operation is executed, it nows checks for previous execution in the reporter and if a successful execution was found in the past, it will skip the current execution and return the previous successful result.

Execution will not be skipped if the previous execution was a failure.

An operation or sequence uniqueness is determine by its definition (id + version +description

commits.message:
feat(operations): introduce idempotency behaviour

When a sequence or an operation is executed, it nows checks for previous execution in the reporter and if a successful execution was found in the past, it will skip the current execution and return the previous successful result.

Execution will not be skipped if the previous execution was a failure.

An operation or sequence uniqueness is determine by its definition (id + version +description) and its input

The current execution report will not include any reports for operations/sequences that were skipped.

JIRA: https://smartcontract-it.atlassian.net/browse/CLD-21

feat(operations): add hash cache on reports

Introduce a sync.map to store report cache computed from the sha256 to avoid repeat recomputation.

prs.title: Feature/keep deterministic failure
prs.truncated_body:
* whenever a "WasmDeterministicError" is triggered in a block, the corresponding module gets a `errors.0000012345.zst` file written to the store, directly under the module hash folder.
* when a request comes in, those 'error' files are listed by the tier1, if any of the required modules are broken in that range (or below that range, for a store), the requested is immediately failed with the error

commits.message: write 'errors.0123456789.zst' file in module cache for every failed block, fail if requested range includes it
fail on known deterministic error for the whole segment if we are below linearHandoff

prs.title: Add support for muxed accounts in Soroban host.
prs.truncated_body:
### What

This adds a new host object type to represent muxed addresses (currently only for M-accounts). The new object type is special in two ways:
- Muxed address is a subset of ScAddress, available only through the new object type.
- We don't allow using muxed address as a storage key, in order to prevent footguns (accidentally writing muxed address where a regular address is implied).

A

commits.message:
Add support for muxed accounts in Soroban host.
This adds a new host object type to represent muxed addresses (currently only for M-accounts). The new object type is special in two ways:
- Muxed address is a subset of ScAddress, available only through the new object type.
- We don't allow using muxed address as a storage key, in order to prevent footguns (accidentally writing muxed address where a regular address is implied).

Also added two host functions to split the muxed address into its two parts (the regular address and multiplexing id).

This also bumps XDR and thus adds code/tests for exclusion of the CB/LP address types that can only appear in classic events.

prs.title: Implement retry and caching for system files in modularized flow
prs.truncated_body:
This PR implements a throttle definition parsing mechanism with retry and caching.
If not valid definitions is found in DB we resolve to system file loader.

Mechanism
Retry and parse file data up to 10 times(Similar to RatesAndFeesLoader). Return the first valid from DB. Cache the result
In case of empty DB data - resolve to systemFileLoader -  Cache the result
In case of 10 failures - reso

commits.message:
Implement retry and caching for throttle definitions
